titles.title: To designate the Federal building under construction at 799 First Avenue in New York, New York, as the "Ronald H. Brown United States Mission to the United Nations Building".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management Discharged.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 110-230.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 86.

action.text: Mr. Cummings moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR 7/31/2007 H8935-8937)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 735.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR 7/31/2007 H8936)

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Boxer without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 561.

bill.summary: 1/22/2008--Reported to Senate without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Designates the federal building under construction at 799 First Avenue in New York, New York, as the "Ronald H. Brown United States Mission to the United Nations Building."
